meanings.definition: Not always acting or behaving in the same way
meanings.sent1: She is inconsistently cheerful, sometimes happy and other times sad.
meanings.sent2: His performance at work has been inconsistently good this month.
meanings.sent3: The weather was inconsistently sunny, making it hard to plan outdoor activities.
meanings.sent4: Her mood swings were as inconsistently changing as the wind.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the chameleon's skin were inconsistently shifting, blending with its surroundings.

meanings.definition: Not always following the same pattern or rules
meanings.sent1: The machine produced inconsistently shaped cookies.
meanings.sent2: The team's performance has been inconsistently strong throughout the season.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks were inconsistently successful, sometimes working and sometimes failing.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed inconsistently, changing its course unpredictably.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes were inconsistently precise, creating a unique texture.

meanings.definition: Not always agreeing or matching with something else
meanings.sent1: The data from the two experiments was inconsistently similar.
meanings.sent2: Her answers to the questions were inconsistently accurate.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces fit together inconsistently, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: His actions were inconsistently aligned with his words.
meanings.sent5: The flavors in the dish were inconsistently balanced, creating a surprising taste.
